name: Grand Hotel Amrath Amsterdam

reviews.text: I have just returned from a very nice stay at the Grand Hotel Amrath. The location is great for the train station. The rooms were large and the bathroom had a huge tub and a great shower also. A big TV and a nespresso machine. There is also a free mini-bar in the room available and the beds were so comfy and its seems they have remebered every little detail of anything you could possibly need. I ate in the restaurant on the Monday evening and the food and service was lovely. The staff were very friendly from checking-in till checking-out. I love to come back as soon as posible.
reviews.title: A great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel. Firstly it is very easy to find and a short 10 minute walk from the station. The hotel used to be an office building and as such it is unique in its layout. There isn't a main lobby as such and the reception is in a little side room. The rooms are not huge, but are beautifully decorated. The bathroom is a very decent size with lots of huge fluffy white towels, a super soaker shower and a very deep bath tub. There is a free mini bar which for us was always restocked every day. The wellness centre with pool, sauna and steam room was just wonderful with such helpful and friendly staff and no children which made it super relaxing.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel and fabulous location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple

The restaurant is quite expensive though and you're only a short walk away from some top class and much cheaper places. Don't book breakfast at the hotel as you're so close to the station.

reviews.text: Only stayed for one night, however was so tempted to extend our stay once we arrived. Check in was really friendly and efficient. Escorted to our room (16) which was beautiful. Furnished and decorated to compliment the deco style of the hotel, this is no mass market dull room. This is a beautiful room that is a delight with all the mod cons; complimentary mini bar, nespresso machine, great bath and shower, huge plasma TV, an amazing comfy bed (yes the kings are 2 singles pushed together, but they are so comfy and sturdy that they put up with our bedroom olympics ;-)) All the staff were friendly, the breakfast buffet was very good and all the facilities top noch. This is money well spent.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Amrath for three nights and had two seperate rooms amongst our party. Check in was painfully slow. We checked in on a Sunday evening and the hotel was empty. There were two employees working on checking in another guest so we waited about ten minutes before we could even get our check-in started. The woman who helped us routinely needed help from other employees to complete our check in. With the slow check in behind us we were shown to our rooms. The rooms were great. The beds were so comfortable with high quality sheets, pillows and comforters. There is a complimentary mini bar and complimentary wifi internet service...both pluses even though the wifi was also painfully slow at times. The room contained a big flat screen tv as well although there was no pay per view movie service. The bathroom door was a frosted glass door that provided little privacy and also illuminated the room at night when one used it i.e. everytime one got up in the middle of the night to use the bathroom the other person woke up because of the light. The room was very clean though with great water pressure. The Amrath had a nice lobby bar. We had nightly drinks in the bar and always had good service with great drink options. We ate in the bar one night and the food was good for pub fare. We also had room service one night and it was good as well. I was awoken every day like clock work at 6:11am by some sort of banging that sounded like it was coming from above. Said noise lasted only a few minutes and then stopped, but the damage was done and it left a bad taset in my mouth. I'm on vacation and must sleep in! The elevators were real slow as well and there were only two that I saw. The location of the Amrath seemed slightly off the beaten path. While it was close to the Red light district, everything else of interest seemed kind of far away (museum square, flower market, city center). Now mind you that the city is not that big so I might be nitpicking about the location issue. I would stay at the hotel again because of the clean, nice, modern rooms. However, I might try and find something with a different location before booking next time. This hotel was very expensive and I did expect a little more for the money.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: I decided to take a personal vacation to Amsterdam after I finished the spring semester of school. I stayed at the Grand Amrath after scoring a sweet deal on Expedia.
reviews.title: Amrath was awesome

reviews.text: Checking in was very quick, less than 5 minutes. The entire staff was awesome and willing to help out with anything I needed. The room was spacious with windows on an entire wall. The mini-bar was complimentary as well as the espresso machine. The curtains were electric and the bathroom modern (jacuzzi separate from rainfall shower).

reviews.text: There were only a couple problems. First, instead of getting a king bed, I was given a room with 2 twin beds pushed together. Also, my room was only about 10 feet above the sidewalk, and with people walking by at all hours of the night being loud, it got a little annoying.

reviews.text: Overall I would definitely recommend the hotel. It was a great place to stay, right on the edge of the Red Light District, and only about 800 meters from Central Station.

reviews.text: The Grand Hotel Amrath is within easy walking distance of Central Station. I arrived at the hotel for our four night stay, (a reunion with an old American friend), on March 19 and was greeted by a welcoming reception staff. I was guided to our room by a bellman who gave me a history of the building, formerly offices for a shipping company, it's an unusual piece of architecture both inside and out.
reviews.title: The hotel staff is Grand, for sure.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first thing I noticed about our room, #109, was the dramatically high ceiling and wonderfully large windows with long, extraordinarily long, floor length drapes. Unfortunately our view from these terrific windows, (which could have done with a good clean), looked out onto the back of the hotel and the rubbish bins. The room was stylishly decorated but unfortunately there was very little floor space. They managed to squeeze in a small table and two chairs along with the King-size bed but the room felt cramped. There was space to move about, but just.
reviews.title: Fab Hotel

reviews.text: Even thought the room was small it was packed with lots of fun extras. The 'complimentary mini-bar' was a first for me. They restock it daily so we emptied it nightly. We stashed stuff away just so they would replenish the entire thing. Sounds cheeky, I know, but when we moved to a different hotel for the last three days of our holiday we had a boatload of complimentary supplies to take with us. The closet/wardrobe contained a safe, coffeemaker, kettle, plenty of glassware, cups and saucers, and an umbrella, (really useful, it rained or snowed every day we were there). The coffeemaker with its selection of espressos, cappuccinos and teas, also restocked daily, was a real treat.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

The bathrobes are a nice touch, but again, not really comfortable... maybe it's the detergent they use.

reviews.text: This is a fantastic hotel, real 5 star luxury. My partner and I stayed here in February 2008 on a 3 day city break. The hotel is in a great location for the city centre and only a few minutes walk from Central Station. The unusal building is interesting and very well renovated. Our room was on the ground floor overlooking the harbour and despite a main road outstide it was very quite. The rooms are lovely with beds to die for. Very large and comfortable. We had the free mini bar option which was very welcome. We tried the resturant one night and the food was excellent if a little expensive.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: At the suggestion of Dutch in-laws, we checked the late bookings office just up the straat from the train station. Our rate was half price for 2 nights at The Grand. My then 8 year old daughter was enamoured with the bathroom's square toilet seat. The indoor pool/spa was beautiful and inviting. The bed luxurious. Walking distance close to the town center, canal boats and trolley we happily explored the beautiful old city. Definitely a splurge, even at half price.

description: The newest five-star deluxe hotel of Amsterdam in the monumental Shipping House. You can find us on the Prins Hendrikkade in the city center at only 500m from Central Station and 1100m from Dam Square. We have 165 rooms, of which 25 suites offer complimentary wireless internet, free minibar and from free access to the wellness center. Facilities furthermore include restaurant Seven Seas, meeting rooms and a bar/lounge.
